section.title: Introduction
section.p: The archive operation corresponds to a move operation from the authoring area to the archive

ul.li: the area for the source document
the document id for the source document

section.title: Archive screen
section.source: <map:match pattern="archive" type="usecase"> <map:match pattern="showscreen" type="step"> <map:generate src="content/info/archive.xsp" type="serverpages"/> <map:transform src="xslt/info/archive.xsl"> <map:parameter name="use-request-parameters" value="true"/> </map:transform> <map:call resource="style-cms-page"/> </map:match> </map:match>
section.p: The parameters for the source are get with the serverpage through the page envelope input module. The area for the destination is set to archive in the stylesheet. A form (build with the xslt transformation) sends then the parameters as request parameters with the new URL.

section.title: Archive confirmation
section.source: <map:match pattern="archive" type="usecase"> <map:match pattern="archive" type="step"> <map:act type="task"> <map:redirect-to session="true" uri="{request-param:parenturl}"/> </map:act> </map:match> </map:match>
section.p: The action org.apache.lenya.cms.cocoon.acting.TaskAction calls the execution of the ant task.

section.title: Ant Task
section.p: The ant target archiveDocument is in the publication :
and depends on the different targets

ul.li: firstareaproperties, to set the needed properties dependent of the source area
secareaproperties, to set the needed properties dependent of the destination area
newarchivedocumentid, to compute the unique destination id from the source document id
firstdocumentpath, to compute the directory of the source contents (Needed for the revisions and the rcml files)
secdocumentpath, to compute the directory where are the destination contents (Needed for the revisions and the rcml files)
setIdentifier, to save the source document id (in the dc:identifier). Necessary to be able to restore later the document
move, to execute the different move operations

section.p: More about ant task, see the documentation Ant Task and the Javadoc
